Hi Andy-

That is exactly what we did in our "Target Weights" problem in th=
e following paper:

Clune J, Stanley KO, Pennock RT, Ofria C (2011) On the =
performance of indirect encoding across the continuum of regularity. IEEE T=
ransactions on Evolutionary Computation. 15(3): 346-367.

http://goo.gl/qYH=
PR

Only difference was that it was with HyperNEAT and not NEAT. 

Best reg=
ards,
Jeff Clune

Postdoctoral Fellow
Hod Lipson's Creative Machines Labora=
tory
Cornell University
jeffclune@...
jeffclune.com

On Nov 13, 201=
1, at 1:40 PM, afcarl2 wrote:

> Is anybody aware of a prior application of=
 NEAT, in which the actual individual structure is the output, and NOT the =
activation output of same? The structure of the individual being passed for=
 objective function evaluation and evolution by NEAT?
> 
> Thanks,
> Andy
>=
 
> 


--Apple-Mail-6--694653199
